column4: hmm. next problem... somehow i have lost about 19 GB on a brand new disk... theres never been anything on the disk, but instead of 279GB theres only 261GB free... hows that?
what's df -h say?
it may just be the reserved blocks - you can tune2fs to drop/eliminate those if you wanted
yeah, that's just reserved blocks
if it bothers you, tune2fs -m 0 /dev/sda1
it's actually currently 5 - and if you want 1 instead, make the param 1 instead of 0 in that line I gave you
it's actually "Flav", thanks
you need to run it as root
the line above that likely said "Permission denie"
can you paste the exact command and output?
(pastebin or pm or whatever)
or use http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/
did u get the pm?
no
hmm... 2 sec
what's the output of "mount"?
try tune2fs -m 0 /dev/hda1 to see if that works
you shouldn't need to - i'm not sure why it's not working.
FWIW, though, as Alpha232 said, root is allowed to write to the full capacity, so it's not like that 15GB is really lost
well, if there's nothing of value stored there, you can umount /media/usbdisk then mke2fs -m 0 /dev/sda1
well, you're running as root right now, so you could use those 15GB fine
good
but thnax alot for the help! Real nice!
you can also "sudo -s" to get a shell if you need to do a few different things in sudo and don't want to prefix "sudo" a bunch
